availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson Renaker (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Hutcherson Renaker in Harrison County, Kentucky on September 16, 1852. Father of Louisa Renaker, George Thomas Renaker, Noah Edward Renaker, John Newton Renaker, and James Russell Renaker. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Employed Absolem Folkner as a farm hand in Harrison County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 527.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 116A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #00216896, p. 39.
"Andrew Jackson Renaker (1813-1912)," Find A Grave, Memorial #19486460, accessed April 15, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19486460.
